title: Build post listing view via GitHub Contents API
description: After auth, fetch content/posts/ directory listing from GitHub Contents API. Display posts with title, date, and status (draft/published) extracted from TOML frontmatter. Support sorting and basic search.

title: Integrate markdown editor component
description: Add a markdown editor (CodeMirror or similar) for the post body. Support live preview, basic toolbar (bold, italic, links, images, code blocks). Editor sits below the frontmatter form.

title: Add new post creation flow
description: Button to create a new post. Generates slug from title, sets date to now, creates default frontmatter. On first save, creates the file in content/posts/ via GitHub API.

title: Implement save-as-commit via GitHub Contents API
description: On save, combine frontmatter + body into a complete markdown file with +++ delimiters. Use GitHub Contents API PUT to commit the file. Handle create (new post) and update (existing post, requires SHA). Show commit status feedback.

title: Set up PAT-based auth flow
description: Auth for /edit using GitHub Personal Access Token. Production: password input field with autocomplete attributes to trigger Mac Passwords. Token stored in localStorage. Local dev: DEV_TOKEN in gitignored config.js. Single code path via getToken() fallback chain: localStorage → DEV_TOKEN → null. No server-side code, no OAuth.

title: Scaffold /edit SPA and Netlify routing
description: Scaffold the /edit SPA on the existing Zola site. Vanilla JS modules, no frameworks, no build tools. Dark/light mode support. SPA routing via Netlify redirects.
notes: Decision: no SPA sub-routes for now. Single page, state managed in JS. No Netlify redirect rule needed. Add routing later if bookmarking specific posts becomes valuable.

title: Build TOML frontmatter form editor
description: Structured form fields for Zola TOML frontmatter: title, date, description, taxonomies (tags/categories), draft flag, slug, extra fields (custom CSS/JS paths). Parse existing +++ frontmatter on load, serialize back on save.

title: Add visual editor for blog posts
description: Web-based visual editor for blog posts, served at /edit on the same Netlify deployment. Static SPA using GitHub OAuth for auth and GitHub Contents API for read/write. Each save = git commit (already on remote), push = live via Netlify. Markdown editor with structured TOML frontmatter fields. Supports per-page custom CSS/JS fields. No database — just a static app + one Netlify Function (OAuth token exchange) talking to GitHub API.
notes: Design decision: no SPA sub-routes for now. Single page at /edit, state managed in JS. No Netlify redirect rule. Revisit if bookmarking specific post edit views becomes valuable.

comments.author: Bharat Agarwal
comments.text: Design principle: use Rich Hickey's simple vs easy dichotomy. Always prefer simple (fewer interleaved concepts, single code path) over easy (familiar, quick to set up but complex underneath).

comments.author: Bharat Agarwal
comments.text: Design decision: PAT-based auth instead of GitHub OAuth. Eliminates Netlify Function, OAuth app registration, client secret. Single concept (token) instead of many (OAuth flow, callback, client ID/secret, function). User stores PAT in Mac Passwords, browser auto-fills.

comments.author: Bharat Agarwal
comments.text: Design decision: Svelte + Carbon Components Svelte (IBM) for the editor UI. No Tailwind. Carbon provides 100+ accessible components with SCSS theming. TipTap for markdown editing. Svelte MCP server (@sveltejs/mcp) for agent-friendly development with auto-fixing.
